summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Washington Street, from Twentieth Avenue South to a connection with the existing manhole in the sewer in Twenty-first Avenue South, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing a sewer therein of proper dimensions and material, together with all necessary wyes, openings, manholes, lampholes, flush tanks, catch basins and other appurtenances, in accordance with Resolution No. 170 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
